intro: Siliquastrum, commonly known as the European privet, is a genus of flowering plants in the olive family, Oleaceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or yellowish flowers. The fruits are capsule-like structures called siliques, which give the genus its scientific name. Siliquastrum species are often found in temperate regions and are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants. They play a role in supporting pollinators and can be found in various habitats, including woodlands and gardens.
